texts.value: Protein tyrosine phosphatase which stimulates progression from G1 into S phase during mitosis. May play a role in the development and maintenance of differentiating epithelial tissues. Enhances cell proliferation, cell motility and invasive activity, and promotes cancer metastasis
Inhibited by sodium orthovanadate and pentamidine
Homotrimer. Interacts with ATF5 (By similarity). Interacts with tubulin
Expressed in bone marrow, lymph nodes, T lymphocytes, spleen, thymus and tonsil. Overexpressed in tumor cell lines
Farnesylated. Farnesylation is required for membrane targeting. Unfarnesylated forms are shifted into the nucleus
Belongs to the protein-tyrosine phosphatase family

features.description: 80% loss of catalytic activity; delay in progression through G2/M.
Redistributes to the nucleus in resting cells, but still locates to the mitotic spindle in dividing cells. Induces defects in cytokinesis.

citation.title: Prenylation of oncogenic human PTP(CAAX) protein tyrosine phosphatases.

Multiple phosphotyrosine phosphatase mRNAs are expressed in the human lung fibroblast cell line WI-38.
Subcellular localization of intracellular protein tyrosine phosphatases in T cells.
The tyrosine phosphatase PRL-1 localizes to the endoplasmic reticulum and the mitotic spindle and is required for normal mitosis.
